title: [Finance][251121] In-depth Analysis of the US Stock Market on November 20, 2025: A 'Perfect Storm' Triggered by AI
description: On November 20, 2025, the U.S. stock market experienced a dramatic open-high, close-low reversal. Spurred by a better-than-expected earnings report from Artificial Intelligence (AI) giant Nvidia, the market opened significantly higher, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average surging over 700 points at its peak.

title: [Moment][251203] On Conditional Recognition and Existential Seeing: The Economics of Love and Existential Resistance
description: In our exploration of life attitudes and intimate relationships, a sharp and pervasive dilemma emerges: those we love deeply and trust most—our partners—often implicitly set the benchmarks of a socially recognised successful life, characterised by achievement, development, foresight, and perpetual progression, as the unspoken terms of the relationship. Their departure, prompted by our perceived failure to meet these expectations, is experienced not merely as an emotional loss but as a profound negation.

title: [DevOps][251212] Kill A Process in K8S container, when kill -9 <pid> is noneffective
description: In Kubernetes pods, processes may appear in ps -ef output but fail to respond to kill commands with 'No such process' errors. This occurs when the target process runs in a different PID namespace than the current shell, a common isolation mechanism in containerized environments. Analysis of /proc/<PID>/status reveals the process has dual PIDs: one for the host namespace and another for its container namespace (shown in NSpid). The solution involves using nsenter to enter the target process's namespace and sending signals using its container-local PID, effectively bridging the namespace boundary to terminate the process.

title: [Moment][251223] The Counterfeit of the Sublime
description: Using the character Yu Xiaoqing as a sociopsychological wedge, this analysis dissects the pathology of 'Performative Idealism.' It explores a prevalent modern personality: the sophisticated egoist who camouflages ruthless instrumental rationality beneath an aestheticized moral shell. Drawing on Goffman's dramaturgy and Sartrean 'Bad Faith', the article reveals how these individuals commodify idealism to accumulate power, seamlessly objectifying others when interests conflict. Ultimately, it exposes this 'Machiavellianism in saint's clothing' not merely as hypocrisy, but as a systemic symptom of class anxiety that leads to a profound existential nihilism.

title: [Moment][260105] About Individual Development
description: This analysis introduces the 'Four-Stage Model of Cognitive Stratification', a sociological framework mapping the complex trajectory of individual development against the backdrop of modern social hierarchy. We deconstruct the evolution of competence into four distinct tiers: the institutional screening of basic education, the global leverage of linguistic proficiency, the high-order productivity of abstract logic, and the ultimate class distinction of holistic self-actualization. Synthesising Pierre Bourdieu’s theories of cultural capital with insights from cognitive psychology, this article exposes the invisible mechanics of intergenerational privilege, tracing the arduous ascent from the structural constraints of survival to the exclusive realm of intellectual and aesthetic freedom.
